subject: Art & Design
title: Frank Lloyd Wright and Organic Architecture
description: One-minute skill: Frank Lloyd Wright and Organic Architecture.

hook.text: Frank Lloyd Wright designed over 1,000 buildings. His philosophy: a building should grow from its site like a plant.

buildup.text: Organic architecture blends buildings with their surroundings using natural materials, horizontal lines, and open plans.

discovery.text: Wright's Prairie Houses used low-pitched roofs and bands of windows to echo the flat Midwest landscape.

twist.text: He despised skyscrapers yet designed one of the most famous: the Guggenheim Museum â€” a spiral breaking every convention.

climax.text: His influence spans a century. Open-plan living, carports, and split-level homes all trace back to Wright.

punchline.text: Wright didn't fight nature with architecture. He let nature win.

quiz.question: What is the core principle of Frank Lloyd Wright's organic architecture?
options: Buildings should grow naturally from and harmonize with their site
Buildings should use only recycled materials
Buildings should be as tall as possible
